website_summaries.verdict: The Kasa Smart switch and dimmer showcases a sleek design and delivers in performance and energy efficiency.
pros: Proves to be an energy efficient in-wall smart dimmer choice
Integrates well with Alexa, Google Assistant, Microsoft Cortana, and Kasa app, which boasts an intuitive interface
Works with dimmable LED (150-watt max) or incandescent bulbs (300-watt max)
cons: Deeper in size than standard light switch

website_summaries.verdict: This is a reliable and well-performing in-wall wireless light switch and dimmer that works seamlessly with smart home hub systems.
pros: Energy-efficient, in-wall wireless light switch and dimmer that stays cool to the touch, even after extended use
Easy to install and to connect to smart home hubs and Kasa app
Fits in all standard USA electrical boxes
cons: Neutral wire is required for installation, so may not work in older homes

customer_reviews.title: Kasa Smart Wi-Fi Dimmer switch doesn't dim
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product. It doesn't work and the customer service is horrible. I called in and they asked for my email address and would only troubleshoot with me through email. It takes them over a day to respond to the email. After a while, they just stop responding to your emails completely. Had to just return the product because I was never able to get the product to dim. Installed my old dimmer and everything works just fine. The switch works with the app and Alexa, it just wont dim.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: Installed my new TP-Link Kasa Smart Dimmer Switch and I must say directions were easy to follow and easy to add to Alexa!!! Easy to control with voice as you can see in my video. Planning on getting another one for my dinning room. Keep up the good work TP-Link!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Roman Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Defective - Went to Leviton
customer_reviews.text: Let me first say that I waited to write this AFTER installing another smart dimmer that works wonderfully. This thing drove me nuts. After an hour of nothing working correctly, I basically tore apart the gang box to triple check that all the wires were correct. After knowing I had it right, the lights never worked and the unit itself would only have power if the load and live wires were flipped. Today, the Levitron DW6HD arrived and I had it installed and connected to wifi and lights working in 10 minutes. The Levitron just feels better made too and was the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Kingo

customer_reviews.title: Great New Smart Dimmer from TP-Link.
customer_reviews.text: Most reviews for this listing are for the HS200 Smart Switch. This is NOT that product. This product is actually the newly released HS220 Smart Dimmer. Yes, it is a dimmer and works great with the Kasa app and Amazon Alexa. Very easy installation and setup but you must have a neutral wire at the switch location for this to work. Alexa integration is also a snap to configure. Be advised that this is only rated at 300W incandescent which is pretty low if controlling a bank of incandescent ceiling can lights. LED is a hefty 150W though. I also have a TP-Link Smart Switch (HS200) and 2 Smart Plugs (HS105) that work equally as well.
customer_reviews.author: davige

customer_reviews.title: Cool little switch with one hiccup
customer_reviews.text: I'll update the review if anything goes badly but so far I like the switch. The one bad thing is that this thing is HUGE for a lightswitch, they must've used the largest size allowable for a single gang, decora style switch. I have older romex wire, so very still and I think I may invented a new curse word or two while trying to make it fit. It did go in though and connects easily enough. Just make sure you have dimmable bulbs and may be wise to check behind your old switch before upgrading! You will need both hot and neutral for this to work back there.
customer_reviews.author: Tonka

customer_reviews.title: When it works, its cool.
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my workshop to control the lights. Instead of running wire for a two-way switch, I put this smart switch on one end with the idea of using Alexa if I come or go from the other end. When it works, it is wicked cool; "Alexa, turn on the Shop Lights". Unfortunately it is kind of hit-or-miss on if it will work. Most of the time it does, but very frequently (like when I am showing off for the neighbors), it simply won't respond. Think they may need to improve the technology a bit before I would give this a strong endorsement.
customer_reviews.author: Earl D Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great looking switch, Great functionality
customer_reviews.text: Great dimmer switch. Easy to install (as long as you know basic electrical), easy to setup and integrate with my network and control devices (Alexa). Looks great. Functionality is great as well. Works well with my LED bulbs. Setting it up in the app was easy to do and I like the recommendations it makes for the dimming range for each bulb (different bulbs require different minimum power levels to turn on).
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link Smart Dimmer Switch
customer_reviews.text: This is my first purchase of the Smart TP-Link dimmer switch and now I want more. I thought this would work for a 3-way switch but I had to end up using the one I purchased in another room. Other than that, it works great. With this brand, you can turn the lights on when the switch is off with your phone or Amazon connected device. Edit: With Sengled WiFi light bulbs , you can only control the bulbs with your phone or Alexa controlled device when the light switch is on. So I will go with converting to the smart switches instead of buying smart bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: DShopper

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have switched most of the switches in my house to tp link switches. If you are comfortable around electricity, it is decently easy to install. The switch is big. I have old small boxes in my house, so I had to replace some of the boxes to get the switch to fit. After about a half a year, one of the switches stopped working and I am in the middle of a nightmare of phone calls, chats and emails trying to get them to honor the warranty. It has been three weeks, and I'm still trying with no luck to get them to replace my defective switch under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Rik

customer_reviews.title: DON'T MISS THIS WiFi TIP!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it and works after figuring out the WiFi installation issue I was having. My one big tip...... ((((((MAKE SURE THE ITEM CONNECTED TO THE SWITCH IS "OFF" DURING PROGRAMMING))))))) I had so much time wasted trying to get it to connect to my WiFi. It would see WiFi but could not "pair" to it. Kept saying password was wrong. Reset 500+ times, okay 5 times, and still failed.... Just for fun, in the dark, because I turned off the lights from the switch. I reset one last time and BINGO was his name O..... It worked.... Have fun and be safe....
customer_reviews.author: Hemmi06

customer_reviews.title: Kasa Is The Brand To Watch For!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously well designed smart switch product. I have purchased other “smart” products from this company before — a WiFi surge protector and a smart plug — and both have exceeded if not matched my expectations thus far. This switch is no exception to that rule — it’s a handsome, well-designed product. The only real gripe I have with it, is that the “click” sound it makes when manually pressed Is overly reminiscent of the sound my computer mouse makes when I press it. I was debating if there was an other flaw or defect I had to bring up about this smart switch but in the end I came up with nothing. Well done, an “A” all across the board.
customer_reviews.author: Jin Peng

customer_reviews.title: A solid purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Very easy to install. - Confirmed dimmer works perfectly with led and incandescent bulbs. - Price - Much cheaper than other comparable products and provides high quality Cons - User interface is a bit busy. I wish it was easier to schedule lighting routines and randomize the schedule. Additional thoughts: Another great feature is it comes with a cover plate if you're using a single gang. I did not need it for this particular install but it is nice to know.
customer_reviews.author: QSFYC - Support Guy

customer_reviews.title: Has a local API as well
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Using it for 4 recessed lights with BR 40 LED bulbs. Love that they fade out when you turn them off. Connected the dimmer to Alexa easily. These switches have a local API that is directly accessible that doesn’t go through the TP-Link cloud. This is great if TP-Link ever goes out of business or drops support for these switch products. I verified that this API works by using this script from github (doesn’t matter that it says HS100) github: branning/hs100 Using the local API isn’t user friendly but it is easy for someone who is technically minded. Hope this helps someone.
customer_reviews.author: kr4sh

customer_reviews.title: One of the best smart dimmer switch ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Been wanting to convert my standard switch to dimmer-able smart switch for a long time. I brought several brands of smart switch back such as from Lutron Caseta, WeMo, Honeywell, GE and TP-Link Kasa. Most of them are either doesn’t work, hard to install, or disappointed result after installed. By far, Kasa is the easiest and best dimmer result out of all these smart switches. Kasa dimmer smart switch has best dimmer presets, total 6 preset dimming levels. I like the maximum brightness level, and set to schedule sunrise/sunset to turn on and off automatically. Love the end result that sets different moods at my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, but limited to 3 smart actions
customer_reviews.text: Kasa is a good product. I've installed over 20 switches in my home and they are very easy to install and integrate into WIFI. The problem is the product is limited to only 3 smart actions. Therefore, you have all these smart devices but are extremely limited in how you can use them. That causes you to be constantly reaching for your mobile to turn on or off lighting scenes or other devices. It's truly puzzling and frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Invincible Summer

customer_reviews.title: They always lose connection to the network
customer_reviews.text: I have my entire home wired with these smart dimmers. I'm sorry, but these are terrible switches. They'll work great for a certain period of time and then lose connection to the network. Then reconnecting them to the network is a pain because sometimes they won't connect AT ALL. They'll stay in this RED LIGHT error state for days. Then eventually when they feel like it, they'll reconnect. It's frustrating. I've followed all the "tech support" advice (btw, tech support is like ONE LADY here in southern california and nothing WORKS) and they still suck. I would never buy it ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Lou W.

customer_reviews.title: Almost threw the thing away
customer_reviews.text: I short, the install is retarded. DO NOT ATTACH THE LOAD BEFORE YOU PAIR IT. Or it will kick and scream that it can find the switch. Nevermind that your phone will be locked on the switch as an access point. and you will have to go in to setting to make it stop trying to use the switch to get to the internet. NOOOOO that's not good enough. Thank god I thought to try it one more time while I was removing it on the way to the trash can. Jesus thats a stupid design. It make me worry about the guts of this thing that it has that hard of a time functioning with a load attached....
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Davis

customer_reviews.title: A lot better than Wemo
customer_reviews.text: We have so many Wemo smart plugs but I guesse due to our internet connectivity a lot of times they are not connected, imaginng how frustrating when you have smart plugs that won’t connect. So We bought one of these to test since we never had any TPlink before. Beyond our expectations this works great, they connect and react so fast and work so well that we switched all our wemo to TPlink.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Audible buzz
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in our family room which as 4 LED recessed lights that are dimmable. It works perfectly when on and dimmer set to max light, however, if we lower the lights below 90%, there is an audible buzz and it's quite annoying.
customer_reviews.author: A S

customer_reviews.title: Alexa, set the lights to 50%
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these dimmer switches and I am very very pleased with them. They are perfect for controlling groups of lights, such as a multi-light fixture, or a circuit of recessed lights in a room. The switches are pretty easy to install but you certainly have to be comfortable with basic electrical. Look up YouTube videos to see what’s involved. My mom certainly wouldn’t feel comfortable doing this. I haven’t had any problems with WiFi connectivity or anything like that. The switches are great. The only complaint is that they’re kinda bulky so it CAN be very hard to get them to fit together nicely in a multi switch box.
customer_reviews.author: Zach G

customer_reviews.title: Just like the Jestsons
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Will buy more. Great price. The app and Alexa integration works well. I do feel maybe these can use a little bit more adjustment for brighter light at full brightness. Seems like it’s not turning the light to full potential. I don’t know I could be wrong. But it still works great. Only issue when installing I noticed is when connecting to the wifi. It won’t find automatically find any at first try but will on the second try. Other than that, install is easy, looks great and works great. I had a Wemo before this but the app and price a bit more on the KASA TP-Link.
customer_reviews.author: AmmozonTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and operate
customer_reviews.text: I have a few Kasa switches at this time, and they all work well. The install is straightforward, and using the Kasa app to integrate them into my so-called smart home is pretty easy. I like being able to shutoff all the lights by saying "Hey Google, goodnight" each night as part of my routine. Makes it easy to be lazy! Also I can dim this one using voice commands, and my morning routine starts my day with this one at 25% brightness, which helps me wake up gradually. Anyway, I recommend these switches if you're looking to automate - no complaints at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Spade

customer_reviews.title: Kasa HS220 Dimmer Dims my 4 LED Cans setup perfectly
customer_reviews.text: After reading the review that said it could only dim ONE LED bulb, I was skeptical making the purchase, but I own about a dozen Kasa plugs and smart switches and they have all worked FLAWLESSLY. I'm glad I gave it a try because it works fine dimming 4 LED Cans. It dims from very low level to bright just like my old Levitron dimmer it replaced. Pretty COOL. I would highly recommend since they have been discounted this past week. I would also recommend UPGRADING your WIFI to a MESH system if you haven't already. This will definitely improve the performance of these WIFI devices. GOOD LUCK.
customer_reviews.author: QQQ

customer_reviews.title: New toy for modern bedroom
customer_reviews.text: Was planning on upgrade my whole house to modern home and smart switch is one of key elements. Overall install is not difficult but you need some knowledge on electricity: Hot line, Load line, Nature Line,..... Quality is good and app control is solid. just the dimmer percentage on 30%-1% is the same result, but I guess that is the limitation of digital switch design/circuit. Not sure about Alexa since I have not enable to feature, but looks like most feedback from youtube is good. the bottom line: no problem to recommend the product
customer_reviews.author: An odinary father

customer_reviews.title: Dead On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these dimmer units (separate orders!) and both arrived dead. Would not respond at all. I know had them wired correctly because a a regular TP-Link wall switch (non dimming) wired the same way in the same box worked fine. I’ve had great luck with all my TP-Link smart outlets so was very surprised and frustrated by these defective units.
customer_reviews.author: W. Kothman

customer_reviews.title: Dimmer is great - easier to install than the switch
customer_reviews.text: I love the KASA dimmer - I recently changed over all my smart switches to KASA so I have one system in my house. I previously had WEMO and a few other minor companies. The price point on this makes it easy to place everywhere in the house. The dimmer works with every light I have used so far (that is dimmable!). The soft on and soft off features are great! The only thing missing from it at the moment is smart cross integration - so that a long press or double press could control another KASA element (Like a bulb or a smart plug)
customer_reviews.author: Dov C.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but...
customer_reviews.text: THE CONS * These have a noticeable delay when turning on, even when set to "Instant On", which is very annoying when you're in a hurry. * Soon after install, these had network issues. They would be fine for a day and disconnect for a few days and then start working properly after that. Restarting and reconfiguring didn't help, either. * Might be a little too wide for SOME older outlet/switch boxes. Especially installing 2 or more smart switches in one multi-gang box. THE PROS: * The price for a name brand switch. * Blends in with similar looking manual rocker switches. * Set-up was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: KID333

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install/great dimming features
customer_reviews.text: Great smart dimmer switch! Just installed this in my room recently and absolutely love it. Install was super easy and connecting it to my google home was a breeze. Love the dimming ability and the fact that it softly turns on and off the lights, as opposed to an abrupt off/on. Definitely worth getting if you need a smart dimmer. Works on my Edison bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Aaqib

customer_reviews.title: As a functional product it deserves a five star but...
customer_reviews.text: First of all, great product works as advertised. It is simple to install and works great with Google Home I recommend it no doubt. However; it tends to be a bit bulky, I don't know if that much space is needed to house all the electronics but in many cases, it makes it hard for it to fit into an average electric box. I had to do some cabling magi to make it fit, more than I should have to when installing a switch. If you have an older home with small boxes, just be aware of this.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and feeling switch. Has a 'tactile' button, unlike the competition. No SmartThings :/
customer_reviews.text: I bought a variety of switches to evaluate which ones I wanted in my home. While I picked another company that integrates with SmartThings for the majority of them, I still like this switch because it has a raised button that you don't have to search for in the dark. For a room like a guest bathroom, or near and entrance, these are much easier to use than the other switches that are completely flat. I also really like the double-click feature that fades the lights slowly so you can walk away. I have one or two more places that I will be installing these, for those two features.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Spencer

customer_reviews.title: This switch works well and is a good value
customer_reviews.text: I have looked at a lot of Smart switches and purchased another brand with limited success. I purchased the Kasa switch based on specifications and reviews. I am happy with the switch, the Kasa app, and integration with Alexa. I am driving LED and incandescent lights with two different switches and both work well. Installation can be a pain depending on the state of the wiring in the electrical box, but this has nothing to do with the switch. I any case, after buying the first dimming switch I bought a second and a package of two three way switches. The next purchase will be the Kasa Smart Plug.
customer_reviews.author: GCI Larry

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE ITEM, POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: This is a very attractive dimmer! We just installed 3 other dimmers with our new LED lights. We received this item and were perplexed that only 2 wires were attached (all the others had 3, and worked GREAT). The instructions show 3 wires and I contacted the company to confirm. Rather than wanting to send me a Non defective product, they told me to Consult with an electrician. I do NOT need to pay someone to tell me what I already know! I would be happy if there was better Customer Service.
customer_reviews.author: Sblair71

customer_reviews.title: Working Now
customer_reviews.text: I was confused at first as I thought the switch toggles mechanically like a regular switch - it certainly looks like it should. However it operates by simply pushing the button until it makes contact and then the switch returns to its original position. Probably a dumb misunderstanding on my part, however none of the videos or instructions explain or show this. Once I figured this out I was able to get it working. As others have noted, LED lights do not get as dim as I would like them too, but the dimming is adequate. Customer service is slow and you will be responsible for the cost of returning a warranty item.
customer_reviews.author: H.D. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Product!!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this dimmer switch--from the packaging, to the fit and finish of the materials used, to the app install, to the extra little things included like wire label stickers to mark the wires in the junction box. You simply can not beat this product and surprisingly the price is almost the same as much lesser smart switches on the market. Alexa integration is perfect, too. I have bought and installed several different brands of switches and plugs over the last few years and this one is by far the finest. I am a professional designer myself and I must to the team who developed this well done!!
customer_reviews.author: Ro66e

customer_reviews.title: And Other Kasa Devices ....
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased the Smart Switch and Smart Plugs. App works great. The Smart Plug is a little big and takes up more than it's share on a duplex outlet. Be prepared to put it on a power strip or an extension cord. Aside from that works great. The apps ability to program to pick and choose sunrise or sunset times are great. It even knows what area you live in so hopefully it will adjust for daylight savings time changes. I would buy another or replacement in a second.
customer_reviews.author: My Thoughts ....

customer_reviews.title: One i got works great, the next one did not work at all.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these a few months ago. It installed and worked great right out the box and still does to today. So ordered another one. This one did not work at all out of the box. It would blink orange only every 5 seconds or so and would not allow pairing to WIFI, and did not do anything except blink orange. 100% defective items are being shipped out. These are obviously untested. When it works its great. Based on reviews too many times for a $30 switch it comes DOA.
customer_reviews.author: Artemis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to do even by beginner
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dimmer switch after purchasing some KASA outlets. I was so pleased with the outlets that I decided to give their dimmer a try. It was very easy to wire and connect to the Wi-fi system with the KASA app. Then I connected it to my Alexa network. The Alexa recognizes KASA products and since I had already connected the outlets, it automatically recognized the dimmer. I am very pleased with it so I ordered a KASA three way dimmer for the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: GasCan

customer_reviews.title: Annoying start up delay
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a few months now. I like most everything about this switch except for the ~1sec delay when you press the physical switch. It gets annoying as you think you it didn't register and are about to hit the switch again when it finally turns on. I do like being able to use my phone to turn it on/off, adjust the light level but I'm not sure it's worth the start up delay. Picking 'Instant' for the Fade On delay in the app didn't help.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Wi-Fi dimmer switch
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and install. Remember you need 4 wires in your existing wall box; the neutral of course keeps the switch with power to stay on Wi-Fi 24x7 and receive signals to power on from the App. Of course you need a ground wire then the standard load and line wires. I got these mixed up and the switch didn't work so I reverse them and I'm operational. The app allows you to dim the light as well. A great solution for >$20.
customer_reviews.author: Tom from ID

customer_reviews.title: Installs easy with some electrical knowledge, functions well from wall and app.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Kasa Dimmer after six other Kasa switch installs. Pros: 1. Step-by-step instructions in app were very helpful (as always). 2. Very reliable WiFi switch (have tried others). 3. Others (non-technies) in home finds operation easy and a great value add. Cons: 1. Needs a little electrical knowledge (line & load) 2. Instructions to setup operational dimming did not transition smoothly (online research helped) 3. Seems to run very hot at 75% (unlike previous regular dimmer) but monitoring. Overall: Good product but due to its required function will update review after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Real Star

customer_reviews.title: Requires a Kasa account to use
customer_reviews.text: I have some Kasa outlets(HS-103) in my house that work pretty good so I went ahead and got this dimmer for my bedroom. I use the outlets in the local only mode with my HomeAssistant install. When I read the instructions I found that this product does not work in local only mode. You need to create a Kasa account in order for you to complete the install through the app. This is a deciding factor for me as I am not interested in having my switches cloud connected.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guy 2013

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set-up, works flawlessly with Alexa and the app is bug-free totally useable. I own several Kasa Smart Plugs and Switches but this is my first Dimmer. I was not expecting so many cool features!! This switch actually wakes me up in the AM with a gentle simulated sunrise!! Everything the switch is capable of is customizable. All without a hub. Truly an incredible value with rock solid reliability. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Living Luxe

customer_reviews.title: awesome dimmers!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mostly because they didn't need a hub to work. Love these dimmers already and very happy with the purchase. Easy to install and works great on the app. I also love I can remote control the lights when out of the house. It even has a timer to turn on at certain times, will test it out for a morning wake up. Bottom line, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Has sunset/sunrise offset
customer_reviews.text: Great device. Looks good. Relatively easy to install, it was a bit hard to cram everything back in the wall box. Unlike some other TP-link smart plugs I have with this one you can turn on/off things a specific number of minutes before or after sunset/surnise. With my other smart plugs I had to change my location in order to fake the offset. I am using the dimmer with my Costco outdoor lights, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: treble101

customer_reviews.title: so far i really like it
customer_reviews.text: it could use a little more ability to customize scenes more. for example. in one scene i want the lights to dim slowly but in another i want them to instant off or when i press the button its instant off but the dimming speed is in the switch setting not the scene settings so everything uses the same setting. i put 2 of these in a media room and have a movie night scene that i want to dim slow like in a theater but when i press the button it should just turn off. i keep having to wait on it before leaving the room thinking i didnt hit the button right.
customer_reviews.author: N. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: The switch does its job and the setup was easy. The Kasa app guides you step-by-step with pictures on how to install. The app and switch are also rich with features. The switch has a memory and turns on with last dimmer brightness setting. Double tapping the switch makes it turn on/off slowly. Holding the switch gives an instant on/off. These settings can be changed in the app. You can control lights while away from home. Set dimming schedules, which I used mine to turn on in the morning as a wake-up alarm. Overall, easy to setup, easy to use, feature rich, and does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: This product integrates well with my ceiling LED lights
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as part of a kitchen remodel. This unit allows us to tie in the ceiling lights to our Alexa controlled lighting scheme (the undercounter lights are the Phillips strip lights). We can control the lights from 100% down to 1% (which works well as part of our "movie night" scene). Please note: Installation does require a neutral wire so I had to rewire the switchbox. This was a small price to pay for the convenience of this type of switch. Now that it is installed, it maintains sync with our controller very well. I would purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: E.T.

customer_reviews.title: Good dimmer. Easily installed
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this dimmer in my study. I installed it myself and I’m not an electrician. Just follow the directions. I downloaded the Kasa application and everything was straightforward and easy. It works very well, it responds quickly to commands and the application has a lot of helpful features. The main issue I’m facing is a buzzing sound coming from the bulbs when they’re dimmed. It’s a very soft buzz, can be easily masked with soft music. The light bulbs are LED FEIT and it seems an incompatibility between dimmer and bulbs. But not a big deal. I’m getting many Other Kasa products. The cameras will have to wait until it allows to record locally on my NAS.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, easy to install, and super “smart”!
customer_reviews.text: We installed two for our recessed lighting and it installed to our WiFi through the Kasa app easily, no hub required! I connected it to Alexa much more easily than my other smart lights, so we can turn off the living room lights from our bedroom Echo now which is handy. This was more affordable than other smart light options and yet, perfect to what we needed with a full range of functions through the app!
customer_reviews.author: SchwebelJ

customer_reviews.title: works perfect
customer_reviews.text: great value. and works very well. also very easy to install. i use them for my living-room ceiling mounted led lights. replaced a dimmer that i got from a big box store with this kasa dimmer. i think my lights are brighter due to a quality controller built into the kasa unit. my home is completely controlled by kasa equipment and i have zero problems with their products. i just love a smart home. thanks kasa...
customer_reviews.author: p flyer

customer_reviews.title: Delightful Home Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty stingy with five stars but these Wifi dimmers deserve it. I have installed two of the dimming and one non dimming switch and they integrate flawlessly with Alexa. Install was easy (I should disclose I do electrical for a living but I think any reasonably handy person can get it done safely following the instructions) The Kasa software has improved to the point that setup was accomplished without needing to read the directions. I particularly liked the scenes that can be configured any way you like. I have one group with a mix of halogen and two different kinds of LEDs and they play together with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Parkeralto

customer_reviews.title: Works Great But Does Need a Neutral Wire
customer_reviews.text: The switch works great. The only problem is it requires a neutral wire. Some switches, like the ones that switch off an outlet, don't have a neutral wire, just a hot wire that is interrupted by the switch on its way back to the outlet. I had to run a neutral wire to an outlet on the other side of the wall for my installation, not that difficult but more than just swapping out light switches.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Reliable quality dimmer
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 5 of these particular dimmers as well as 26 total Kasa plugs and switches to use around the house. It's remarkable that none of them have come DOA and not a single one of them have had a single malfunction since installation. I just wish they had a configuration that would control both the ceiling fan and the ceiling lights in one unit. I tried to install a dimmer switch by another manufacturer and had a major issue with the flickering lights. In the end, I am going back to this dimmer to control the fan lights while the fan motor will have to be directly wired bypassing the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Stan-the-man

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I got this to control our lanai fan. I have an echo out by our outdoor kitchen and it’s nice to be able to completely control my lights and fan without having to go inside to do it. I can ask Alexa to turn on/off. Or change speed 25%, 50%, 75%, 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Coastal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome smart dimmer.
customer_reviews.text: This Kasa smart dimmer switch was easy to install. There is a Youtube video that shows great installation instructions. The Kasa app installation instructions are not that thorough. Once you have the switch installed correctly the Kasa app will get you connected to your wifi. The Kasa app has alot of features, and connects to Alexa easily. The dimmer switch is well worth the money, happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ripshion

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation & setup
customer_reviews.text: This switch was simple to install and setup, provided you have a little electrical knowledge. The included instructions were clear and simple to follow. Everything needed for installation was included. However, as I installed this switch in a three-gang box, I needed a separate switch plate (but it will be dependant on your particular installation). Dimmer function is smooth via either the manual buttons or by using Alexa. BTW, the switch also works with Google Home.
customer_reviews.author: David Applegate

customer_reviews.title: Simple.
customer_reviews.text: Got one after trying two other brand dimmers that refused to connect to any of my apps or WiFi. Having used the Tp-link single pole switches for a while I decided to go back to what works. Immediately integrated into my device network and meshed perfectly with echo controls. Bought another for my “theater” lighting, which lets me dim the filament tube bulbs in my sconces down to 1% just by yelling “movie time!” Like a mad man until the echo decides to pay attention.
customer_reviews.author: Sobertese

customer_reviews.title: Very cool and works great
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say this is a very connected house. There were 4 Kasa outlets already installed here. The dimming function works properly, and the app is easy to use. Integrates easily into Google Home and Alexa. Installation is not the easiest. Don't bother if you don't have a neutral wire (and know what a "neutral" is) In the junction box - in needs that wire. Also, the switch is very big and deep so it takes it up a good deal of the box.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Very nice switch
customer_reviews.text: This was the first dimmer I had installed that was Alexa compatible. Compared to the HS200, this one is just a bit more tricky to install because you have two screw terminals and you actually have to know which wire is hot and which is going to the light. Otherwise, connecting it to Kasa and adding it to Alexa is just as easy and once calibrated to your lights "dimmest" ability, you can tell Alexa to set the light to 50% (for example).
customer_reviews.author: James Zawacki

customer_reviews.title: THE smart dimmer
customer_reviews.text: Kasa has come a long way from the early days. This is a good smart dimmer that is easy to install and sync with Alexa and the Kasa app. So far no issues with any of my other Kasa switches so I know this one should last a while.
customer_reviews.author: A. Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: These work great as long as you use quality dimmable bulbs and dimmable ballasts. If you're having problems double check your bulbs and ballasts. I had bought Phillips LED MR16 dimmable bulbs, but the seller shipped non-dimmable. I thought the problem was the switch at first. Another review makes it sound like you can only control one bulb with these. That's not correct. I'm using these switches on track lighting with 1-12 fixtures per track with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Living Room Lights I can control with my voice!
customer_reviews.text: I have been gradually upgrading my house with smart devices, and when I saw the TP Link dimmer with Alexa voice commands for this price point I had to give it a try. It works amazingly! With voice commands you get an even wider dim range. "Alexa, turn the living room lights on to 45%." Very happy with my decision. Like other reviews have noted, make sure the switch you are replacing is equipped with a neutral wire.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Forsyth

customer_reviews.title: Great dimmer switch for use with Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: I use it with Amazon Alexa so I can turn off the light or turn it on or dim it with my voice. I love it. I used 14/2 Romex (wire) to connect it. The wiring in my house is old so I had to replace it so the switch would have a neutral wire. It will not work without a neutral wire, believe me because I tried. Also, the switch will work without Alexa like a normal light switch. There are small buttons you can press to dim or brighten as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bradleigh Gray

customer_reviews.title: Works. Most of the time...
customer_reviews.text: The dimming function is cool. My family likes the effect when they power down. These are easy to install if you know what you are doing. In App instructions are very helpful. These appear to fall off my network randomly. I have more than ample wifi coverage, but for some reason on occasion the devices are not accessible. I installed them myself and had the installation verified by a certified electrician when he was doing other electrical work. The units are big, so be aware that you might have difficulty fitting it into your switch box.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Lundberg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I’m usually extremely picky and over critical about smart home stuff, as I’m sort of a technology snob. These light switches are gold. Decently priced, mobile apps are surprisingly well designed and work very well, easy-ish to setup, very reliable, and just overall amazing. I’ve purchased about 16 of the TP Link switches and a few dimmers. I’d highly recommend these regardless of desired level of smart home, from beginner to smart-home nerd.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Zero issues
customer_reviews.text: I now use TP-Link smart switches in lieu of any other type of light or timer switch. These smart switches are easier to program, easier to install and less expensive than most Lutron, Leviton or other controlled switches. I have some programmed to turn off after 10 minutes, some are programmed on a schedule and setting them to random "away" mode between certain times of the day is very easy. The dimmer is easy to use and easy to control using the app.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cascoli

customer_reviews.title: Another great Kasa device
customer_reviews.text: This dimmer switch is the 4th different type of Kasa devices I purchased after the plug, bulb, and outdoor cameras. They are all controllable from a single app and Alexa. I will continue to add to my Kasa TP Link ecosystem due to the good value and reliability. The dimmer is pretty bulky and is a trick to fit in the electrical box, but patience pays off for the features you get.
customer_reviews.author: Korben Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Good: -works well with Alexa. -easy to install. Not so good: -looses the connection with the wifi router once in while, despite its close proximity. -when it looses wifi you cannot turn the light on (that's a pain), fortunately it reconnects quickly. -doesn't dim much, would like to the lowest setting to be darker. -small delay between the time you press the button and when the light turns on. -switch is a little stiff.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install and configure.
customer_reviews.text: Installed 3 dimmers in place of failing Insteon dimmers. Setup is a breeze with provided step by step instructions in the app. Wire labels that come with each dimmer is a nice touch. Great app interface and ability to adjust settings to your liking. Nice materials on the switch and decora covers. Planning on getting all of my switches replaced now.
customer_reviews.author: morozgrafix

customer_reviews.title: Can be calibrated for true dimming all the way down to almost off!
customer_reviews.text: Great dimmer! Work flawlessly with Alexa. This can dim my LED recessed lights down to practically off without a flicker. I had a different brand that I got on here that wouldn’t dim enough and the light would be too bright. This one has a calibration setting so you can adjust the brightness down as far as your bulb will allow. Oh and they work fine with multiple bulbs on the same circuit. No idea why other reviews were having problems with that. Maybe they didn’t wire or calibrate it properly?
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Beach

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: These lights are awesome and work great! I was hesitant because they were priced nearly the same as getting any other non-smart dimmer switch, so I thought too good to be true. It's been almost a year and still work great. I have them set up schedules and can talk to Alexa for turning off/on/dimming. I'm now setting these switches on all our main rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Kambria E.

customer_reviews.title: Good switch and works well
customer_reviews.text: The switch is great but the support was lacking from Tplink. Originally, I couldn't get the switch to work because I installed it on the wrong neutral wire. My switch box had 2 switches, one single pole and one three way pole. I accidentally connect it to the three way pole netural and the switch/lightbulbs was just flashing on and off. With no help from their support, I figured out that there are two neutral wire in my switch box and connecting it to the other neutral did the trick. So far it works well and function great with Google assistant.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great until it doesn’t.
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to install and use. BUT if there’s a WiFi failure or power, one or two of the switches will go out and they won’t reconnect. I have to reset them. The Kasa instructions tell you which side is reset and what color it should be but not HOW to fix it so I end up having to delete it and reset it. if I want to get help. I have to answer all these questions that I don’t know the answer to.
customer_reviews.author: catlover

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all.
customer_reviews.text: First of all I am not sure how to get the face plate off, without breaking it so I can screw it into the wall. Second it will not even turn the lights on or off. Have not tried to connect to WiFi, since I can't use it anyway. I will stay away from this company. Horrible products and documentation. Well actually there was no documentation at all.
customer_reviews.author: P. V. Cleave

customer_reviews.title: bad support
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months, one of the three purchased ones began to lose wifi very often. I am changing my review from 5 stars to 1, due to the fact that the support service troubled me for 1.5 hours and decided that the next day they would resolve the issue by email. After 3 days they wrote that my case was transferred to another employee and we were starting all over again... It's easier to throw it away and buy a new one, which is what they want.
customer_reviews.author: Anahit Manvelyan

customer_reviews.title: OK smart dimmer switch
customer_reviews.text: Would recommend that you read the instructions and have some base knowledge of electrical wiring. Can watch youtube for video installations. Was easy to connect to wifi and kasa app however switch dropped connection after 2 weeks of usage. Repairing was simple to do. Will have to see the constancy of product over time.
customer_reviews.author: David Terrazas

customer_reviews.title: Must have neutral wire in wall
customer_reviews.text: MAKE SURE YOU HAVE A NEUTRAL WIRE OR WILL NOT WORK. If you have an older house that doesn’t have a set of white wires you’ll have to buy the bridge for the regular smart switch to work as a dimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H

customer_reviews.title: Great Product For The Price just needs a little more
customer_reviews.text: Works well with LED recessed lighting however the set up could be a little easier if they provided detailed wiring diagrams for several layouts, had to search web for correct wiring diagram.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Cav

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye Wemo
customer_reviews.text: After using Wemo smart light switches and smart plugs for 2 years I bought a Wemo dimmer switch. After hours of frustration trying to get it to work with with Alexa I gave up, sent it back, and ordered a TP-Link for $20.00 less. I had some issues getting it linked to Akexa again, but chatting with TP-Link support did the job. I am going to buy TP-Link products from now on.
customer_reviews.author: 001jeff

customer_reviews.title: Works really well with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I have quite a number of TP-Link products and they work really well with Alexa and with the Alexa app. I am having a problem installing this particular product because of limited space in the electrical box that houses all the wire feeding electricity to where this switch has to go. This is not a criticism of the product (it is a great product) but is something to be considered if you are going to buy the product (i.e., make sure there is enough room in the electrical box to take the product.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Gilhooley

customer_reviews.title: Alexa integration at its best
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a control for my living room lights. Easy to setup, easy to link to Alexa, and I never have to manually turn the lights on and off. Takes some getting used to as it's hard to break the habit of flipping a switch (or pressing a button), but it's very handy for me as the switch location is halfway through our room, and was very inconvenient to find in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathon Heyder

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful calibration process, tons of coustomization options, easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Have many of their smart outlets and a few single pole switches. When it was time to replace a faulty dimmer in the basement I was delighted to see TP-link finally came out with an offering. It is far and away the best dimmer switch I have ever used. The circuit has eight high-hat LED bulbs which I had me concerned it would not dim correctly, but the software walks you through a calibration process and dials the range in perfectly. After they are set up the app gives you tons of controls and options; like, a comical amount. Wonderful product, keep up the great work.
customer_reviews.author: Francis D. Arena

customer_reviews.title: fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Great dimmer. But be careful, I had to replace my single gang box in order to fit it. It still just barely fit in with the wires and nuts etc. Overall it still went well and it works FANTASTIC. Using with a new chandelier with 5-60watt incandescent bulbs. Very happy, will buy more when needed No issues with Alexa/Dots etc
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Using this with LED outside lights on a garage. Programmed to dim to "0%" over night so there is still light in case I arrive after 11. No flicker, dimming transitions are smooth. Install and programming were simple. The Kasa app is a little disappointing when making presets for the dimmer - no percentage # shown, only a graphic. I was happily surprised when changing a number of TP-Link products to a new network, the app did keep my prior settings although I had to factory reset the switches to make the network change.
customer_reviews.author: CharlieK

customer_reviews.title: WARNING- LIGHTS WONT TURN OFF
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY It is now 1am and I am writing this review as THE LIGHTS WONT TURN OFF. I have tried everything, restarting it, deleting it from the app, etc. it was working properly for a few hours today and now going to bed nothing is working and the entire room is 100% bright. I am going to try to sleep like this and figure it out tomorrow. I’m also seeing other people with the same issue. I am very technologically savvy there is no solution to this.
customer_reviews.author: gmv646

customer_reviews.title: Great for new recessed lights we installed
customer_reviews.text: Installed two of the smart dimmer switches and they are fantastic for our living room and our dining which we recently installed recessed lights into. Highly recommend these as easy to install, setup, and use smart switches. We are finally finishing our basement and will be outfitting it with more TP-Link smart switches and products.
customer_reviews.author: Teej

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool and useful
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this because she can dim the kitchen before she walks into it. Early in the morning she likes it about 50%. While cooking we can change to 100% without putting dirty hands on a switch. This is great! Only feedback I have is that the device is quite large for installation. When installing it was very tight and made me feel a little uncomfortable basically jamming it in. It's really nice. Wish it was a bit smaller for install and supported HomeKit. We plan to with to HomeKit at some point and because these don't support it we didn't buy additional ones because we'll eventually replace the one we bought.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Grim

customer_reviews.title: Just buy them, because they just work
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Installation only takes a few minutes. Linking to Google home was a easy. I like the way you calibrate the switch to the bulb. Some bulbs don't work good with some dimmers because of the range of voltage they work with. Being able to calibrate the switch makes a huge difference. There fade on/off feature is cool too. Awesome
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Must have for alexa owners!
customer_reviews.text: These work amazingly well for the price. I was worried about the alexa integration but I figured i would give them a try and boy was I impressed. Definitely will be buying more for the house. PS. If you have anything more than a single swithch box, Save yourself the trouble and order a matching plate for it. Saves a trip to the local store. Would be nice if they offer a package.
customer_reviews.author: adam watts

customer_reviews.title: I like my Kasa switches and plugs.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first dimmer switch to my collection of Kasa switches. Works well with the four LED lights it controls. In use for about 3 months now. All the other switches have been dependable for a couple of years. A bit of a challenge to install in an older home. It is next to another Kasa switch. I did it myself.
customer_reviews.author: JKA

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating setup but once it works, it’s great
customer_reviews.text: The product works very well once installed. The actual installation was not challenging for someone with basic how-to electrical knowledge. I had a very frustrating time setting the switch up on my wireless network. The portion of the setup where the switch looks for WiFi networks repeatedly failed about less than a second to locate any networks. I had to keep pressing rescan for approximately 20 minutes before it found the network. I purchased 2 dinners and 1 regular switch. All 3 had the same issue and I considered returning them before getting them set up. Now that they are working, they work flawlessly and the Alexa integration was easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Holmes

customer_reviews.title: work great, but not the cover plate.
customer_reviews.text: works great, however, the cover plate has a sharp edge, and no way you can remove it from the switch, "COVER PLATE STAYS FOREVER". no way you can adjust the position. I hope the company will do something on it as this an essential part of the switch. Unless Otherwise break it and get a new one. Tristan Q. Parlin, NJ
customer_reviews.author: Tristangio

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work long
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to work with the light on my ceiling fans (lights not fan) to use with Google nest. They worked well for a week and then lost connection to the network, blinking orange and green. This was odd because I could use the app to control them. I was advised to delete them from the app and set up again so I did. They worked on and off but wouldn't dim. Then I did an update and now they don't work again. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can’t handle power outages
customer_reviews.text: This is a good dimmer switch that works with Alexa. However, it breaks very easily. I bought one and when I plugged a vacuum into the outlet it stopped working. So then I bought another one, and the power went out at my house and it stopped working again. If this switch could handle power outages I would say it’s great, but since they happen often where I live, I cannot use it.
customer_reviews.author: Tillman Rupp

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: More involved than just changing out a light switch. You have to make sure it has a neutral wire, which most light switches don't have oh, I guess you find those in light fixtures and Outlets. But luckily I have a brother-in-law that is a an electrician, around the wire from the light socket to the light switch, and it's up and running beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: cindy nohl

customer_reviews.title: Nice ecosystem, dimmer function works well
customer_reviews.text: I have this switched integrated to our Google Home units. The KASA ecosystem and app is actually very nice and easy to use (I have a KASA camera with works equally well). The switch worked well to control our recessed LED lighting (6 bulbs). Dimming feature works well and was responsive... "google, dim living room lights to 30%" - perfect for movie watching. Worked so well, I ordered 4 more in the subsequent months. I had some drop off in connection, but firmware update fixed the issue. Connects very reliably to the WeeFee. Hoping these last.
customer_reviews.author: howard

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We love our smart dimmer switch. It was easy to install. It took my husband 15 minutes including going to the basement twice to get to the circuit breaker. The app is extremely user friendly and easy to navigate. This is our second TP-Link product and I’m glad I found their products for those reasons. Also, our kids are constantly leaving the kitchen light on and I can just say Alexa, turn off or dim the kitchen light instead of yelling at them from across the house!!
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to install, lights flickered after installation.
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot of help with the installation instructions. Took awhile to figure it out (had a smart dimmer I was replacing). Once installed the lights flickered terribly. Looked online, and it seems to be a typical issue. I will have to get new bulbs tomorrow to make sure I am using the same brand/wattage on the 4 bulbs connected to the switch. Odd that it was fine with the previous smart switch and flickers with this switch.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G Cordry

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install but Missing Live and Load Wires
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a defective Gosund dimmer switch. It was easy to install and set up right out of the box. The app was very helpful. My only complaint is that it didn't come with its own live and load wires. I had a cut some and tie them into the switch from the old switch.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Swymer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE me some Kasa!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the smart plugs and a few switches a long time ago because I just wanted a cheap intro to smart home stuff. Well I was amazed them that the price is good but Kasa products aren’t “cheap”. High quality, easy to install and VERY reliable. My whole house is almost all Kasa and I won’t even bother trying other brands. The app is slick and integration with Alexa seamless. Couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: DaGuru

product_meta.title: Kasa Smart Dimmer Switch by TP-Link, Single Pole, Needs Neutral Wire,WiFi Light Switch for LED Lights, Works with Alexa and Google Assistant,UL Certified, 1-Pack(HS220)
product_meta.description: Control your lights from anywhere with the Kasa Smart Wi-Fi Light Switch, Dimmer. With the Smart Wi-Fi Dimmer, you can control the ambiance of any space with the push of a button. Plus, easily control it from anywhere using the Kasa app or you can use your voice to control when paired with Amazon Alexa, Google assistant and Microsoft Cortana. Protocols supported: IEEE 802.11b/g/n; System requirement: Android 4.1 or higher iOS 9.0 or higher; Wireless type: 2.4GHz 1T1R. Input Voltage: 100 - 120VAC 60Hz, Neutral wire required.
feature_bullets: Voice Control - Works with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant and Microsoft Cortana supported devices for a hands-free experience
Gentle off - Tailor your lighting to fade on with a click of the switch or a double-click to gently fade off the lights while your child drifts off to sleep
Scheduling - Use Schedules to set your smart switch to automatically turn on and off while you're home or away
Note: Requires a neutral wire / Works in a single-pole setup only / Secured 2.4 GHz WiFi network connection
Control from anywhere - Turn electronics on or off from anywhere with your smartphone using the Kasa app (Compatible w/ Android & iOS)

specifications.Included Components: 1 HS220 Smart Wi-Fi Light Switch, Dimmer, 1 Wall Plate, 2 Wire Nuts, Wire Label sheet, Quick Installation Guide
